MediaList.summary: The MediaList interface represents the media queries of a stylesheet, e.g., those set using a link element's media attribute.

blockquote.para: MediaList is a live list; updating the list using properties or methods listed below will immediately update the behavior of the document.

MediaListAppendMedium.summary: The appendMedium() method of the interface adds a media query to the list. If the media query is already in the collection, this method does nothing.

MediaListDeleteMedium.summary: The deleteMedium() method of the interface removes from this MediaList the given media query.

MediaListItem.summary: The item() method of the interface returns the media query at the specified index, or null if the specified index doesn't exist.
MediaListItem.returns: If the bracket ([]) syntax is used and there is no entry for the given index, undefined is returned.

MediaListLength.summary: The read-only length property of the interface returns the number of media queries in the list.

MediaListMediaText.summary:
The mediaText property of the
interface is a stringifier that returns a string representing the
MediaList as text, and also allows you to set a new MediaList.
MediaListMediaText.value:
A string representing the media queries of a stylesheet. Each one is
separated by a comma, for example
screen and (width >= 480px), print.If you wish to set new media queries on the document, the string value must have the
different queries separated by commas, e.g., screen, print. Note that the
MediaList is a live list; updating the list via
mediaText will immediately update the behavior of the
document.When set to the null value, that null value is converted to the empty string (""), so ml.mediaText = null is equivalent to ml.mediaText = "".

MediaListToString.summary: The toString() {{Glossary("stringifier")}} method of the interface returns a string representing the object's values. The value is a comma-separated list of media values in the same format as the property.
